productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Perfect Camera for Keeping an Eye on Our Dogs in the Camper
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I recently purchased this camera to use in our camper, and it has exceeded all my expectations! One of the main reasons I bought this camera was to keep an eye on our dogs while we were away, and it has been fantastic for that purpose.The camera is small and compact, making it easy to place discreetly in our camper without taking up too much space. Despite its size, the video quality is excellent, and I can clearly see what our dogs are up to at all times.What I love most about this camera is that it works off cellular, so I don‚Äôt have to worry about losing connection if there‚Äôs a power outage. This feature gives me peace of mind, knowing that I can always check on our pets no matter what.Setting up the camera was a breeze, and the mobile app is user-friendly and reliable. The motion detection alerts are prompt, and the night vision is surprisingly good. It has truly been a game-changer for us during our camping trips.Overall, I highly recommend this camera for anyone looking for a reliable and compact camera to monitor their pets or property.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I purchased this camera recently to add to my home security. It's honestly a great little camera for the price. The package came quickly and well packaged.  Setting up was extremely easy. As instructed, I charged the camera straight out of the box. While there was some charge initially, I thought it best to give it a full battery before connecting. It charges with a micro USB, a short one was included, I used a longer one I had left over from another device.  After gaining a charge, I followed the printed instructions. They were brief and easy to understand. I downloaded the Ubox app, and was presented with a QR code to scan with the camera. The camera operates on 2.4ghz, not the standard 5ghz of home wifi. I had to configure my Wi-Fi before connecting, and Bluetooth must be on on the device with the app. My service provider's wifi app allowed me to change frequency temporarily, specifically for device set up. Once I was in 2.4ghz, I held the QR code up to the camera. The camera beeped a few times and connected very quickly.  As soon as connected, the room appeared in crisp video in the app. I used SD rather than the available HD to conserve battery, and the picture is fantastically clear!  The camera is small and unobtrusive, making it easy to place. It comes with a stand you can mount, or it can be used freestanding. Positioning was easy, the real-time view in app made it simple to place.  The camera has an option for local storage with a micro SD, not included, I put one in for backup to be certain to back up video in case the app/cloud storage failed - it has not! Nice to know you have options though.  The app is easy to navigate and select your settings. Motion detection has several sensitivity levels to adjust for traffic in the room. I have received all notifications for motion and the clip length recorded can be set for 5, 10, or 20 seconds. Video is clear even in SD mode.  All in all, this camera is the best of the motley assortment I use for home monitoring. It seems well built, the picture is great, and the audio is clear. The app is intuitive and the motion sensor is reliable. I cannot recommend this little cam highly enough for your indoor needs!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I wasn‚Äôt expecting much for the price, but the Vebiliki 2K HD Mini Spy Camera completely surprised me. For such an affordable camera, it packs in a ton of useful features without cutting corners. If you need a little security camera for a project or whatever check this one out.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I have been a big fan of Tozo products since my first purchase in 2021 of their T12 earbuds. Since then I have also purchased their T6, T10, T20, and now their A1 earbuds. While you can‚Äôt expect their sound to compete with high-end earbuds like Bose or Sony, I have always found that for the money you can‚Äôt beat Tozo‚Äôs earbuds. I purchased these A1 earbuds to use while listening to the TV at night. This has been my experience so far with this product:PROS:ÔÅÆ 1. Their small size and light weight make them the most comfortable of all the Tozo earbuds that I have tried.ÔÅÆ 2. The sound is very clear for listening to TV broadcasts and podcasts, where the ability to reproduce a lot of bass is not an issue.CONS:ÔÅÆ 1. The assortment of ear tips that come with these is not as extensive as with some of their other products, and I found that their largest size, which comes pre-installed, was a little smaller than I really needed. I could have used one size larger, which might have improved the bass response for me.ÔÅÆ 2. I had some issues with the sensitivity of the touch controls. With these earbuds you touch and hold the earbud to change the volume. I have found that they didn‚Äôt always respond. I wish Tozo would use one touch for volume rather than having to touch and hold, since I found that sometimes I would touch and hold the earbud to change the volume and if the earbud wouldn‚Äôt respond properly the earbud would turn off because I had held it too long. This hasn‚Äôt been a big problem for me with the TV because I can use the TV remote to change the volume. I hope that Tozo will read this review and look into it. It is possible that the pair I received might be defective.ÔÅÆ 3. If your primary use is going to be listening to music, I would recommend looking into one of Tozo‚Äôs other earbuds, since I did find bass to be a little lacking. These earbuds are more than adequate for listening to podcasts or TV, but for music I would recommend looking at one of their other excellent earbuds, such as their T6 earbuds, which I found to have very good sound quality and are still very comfortable, even though as far as I know they also use a 6mm speaker driver, same size as the A1. As you go up in the Tozo line you start to get bigger drivers (8mm for the T-10, and 10mm for the T12 and T20), so you may be more satisfied with music reproduction with those earbuds. However, there is a tradeoff, since accommodating those larger drivers can also results in a larger earbud. I found the T-6 to be a good compromise between sound quality and comfort.I want to stress, however, that even with some of the issues I had with these they have still become my earbuds of choice for my nighttime TV listening due to their clear voice reproduction and comfort. As is the case for all the Tozo products, they are really an incredible value, and it‚Äôs amazing to me that they can put out products this good at the prices they charge. I continue to be a big Tozo fan, and look forward to trying their future earbud products.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: The predecessor, Z6 II, was an exceptional camera to begin with. The video was acceptable, down-sampled 4K from 6K, it was sharp. The let down was the 8-bit 4:2:0 internal shooting. There wasn‚Äôt much latitude in post, so it wasn't a true enthusiasts hybrid camera. The Z6 II left shooters desiring a more videocentric camera. Now they have it here with the Z6 III, we‚Äôve got the same 24.5mp resolution which is plenty, and exceptional for low light photography and especially video. True Z6 enthusiast didn‚Äôt ask for higher resolution since the Z8 covers that. We got the low light and now we the video features with 6K/60p internal raw at full sensor readout, great waveform, line-in, RAW, ProRES, H.265 and H.264 codecs. Amazing. You got the image quality, now you have the video. This camera is a perfect companion to your Z8 or as it‚Äôs own platform. With Pixel-Shift, it‚Äôs got landscapes covered. It‚Äôs small, it‚Äôs light, and it packs a punch well above its price level. In fact, you cant get these specs in a camera less than $4000

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I have literally been buying these for over 10yrs. I don't even remember how I got the original pair, but they lasted a super long time just using them for music at school. I use them to sleep because the wireless ones are 1. expensive and 2. constantly get lost. the description says "tangle free," which I realize now I've never had tangling be an issue. I get new ones about every 1/2 - 1 year.they will hold up for longer than you expect if you use them for normal use instead of sleeping on them every day like I do. the cord will probably develop an issue where you have to have it a certain way or one of the earbuds will go quiet. this doesn't really matter to me since I'm a side-sleeper and only use one anyways. it's also not a big deal at all if you're at a desk or something.I have Letshuoer S12 pro wired earbuds and wireless Galaxy Buds Pro 2. obviously these do not compare at all to them, however I'm not offended whenever I go from listening to music with the S12s to listening to random YouTube videos with these. the main issue I can see anyone having with these is that the cord noise can be distracting while you're moving around if you're not used to tuning it out. the sound is not insane, it's just really good for being $10. there is no tinny noise to me and I can see someone making them sound a lot better if you're into messing with audio settings. I would say they are very balanced in terms of sound, like they're not super bass-boosted or anything.while there may be better earbuds for music around the $20 price (Moondrop CHU II DSP), the combination of being extremely cheap (you won't cry when they break), lasting for long enough to not be annoying, having no notable annoyances while just listening to stuff, and how lightweight & comfortable they are makes me recommend them to everyone - ESPECIALLY if you're mainly listening to YouTube videos.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: > MUSIC QUALITY ‚Äì The sound-quality of music using the Sony MDREX15LP is very good ‚Äì with typical earbud base.  That‚Äôs just a matter of physics, earbud drivers are simply to small to produce good base.  ("Base boosted" earbuds produce louder base (which smothers the high- and mid-tones), but "loud" (lacking any detail) is not the same thing as "good").  Suggestion, use the earbuds when you are out, but purchase a Sony ZX headphone set for listening to music at home -- and enjoy the base.> VOICE QUALITY ‚Äì Clean, clear and crisp in the voice-range, without fiddling with an equalizer ‚Äì largely because the base is poor.  So these (or similar) earbuds are clearly the choice for listening to audiobooks, podcasts, talking on your phone, etc.  Listening to music, with base-rich music, can be very enjoyable -- but Sony ZX headphones produce far better base than any brand of earbuds, at any price.> Loud vs efficient.  Sony MDREX15LP earbuds are very efficient --- the volume is loud at low volume settings -- not TOO loud, there is plenty of room for adjustment, but louder than many other earbuds and louder than most headsets, at the same volume settings.  Practically speaking, "efficient" means that the earbuds do not drain the battery on your battery-operated device as quickly.  "Efficient" is a good thing.  Also, if you pay attention, you can usually lower the volume, and the sound quality will be just as good -- and your battery will last longer.  Always play music at the lowest setting that you can hear well.  Or you can crank up the volume and plan on being deaf by the time you are 50 --- 40 if you use garbage "base-boosted" earbuds.> EXERCISE, ETC ‚Äì Stays in place better than most earbuds.  But, if you engage in strenuous exercise, consider Panasonic ErgoFit, which fit deeper in your ear.  The down side of the Panasonic ErgoFit is that they fit so securely that it is difficult to get them out of your ear quickly, to answer a phone, etc.> SYMMETRY ‚Äì The Sony MDREX15L are close to being bilaterally symmetrical ‚Äì It doesn‚Äôt really matter if you put the put the left earbud in your right ear, etc.  However, the Panasonic ErgoFit are not, they fit deeper into the ear, and are shaped differently to match your right and left ear canals.  It can take a while to get used to inserting the right Ergofit earbud into your right ear, and the left into the left.> ISOLATION ‚Äì All truly in-the-ear earbuds, with cup-shaped rubber cushions, are good at reducing outside noise, better than headphones ‚Äì often good enough for air travel (depending on the aircraft and the location of your seat).  Many earbud brands claim to feature ‚Äúnoise cancellation‚Äù but do not actually have any noise cancellation circuitry.  Passive isolation (such as provided by the Sony MDREX15LP earbuds), is NOT noise cancellation.  Feedback reduction (on wi-fi earbuds with microphones) is often called noise cancellation, but isn't.  Beware that while true noise cancellation works moderately well for aircraft engines (and similar sounds), it doesn‚Äôt work at all for screaming children or random noise.  If  your earbuds feel loose in your ear, you may need to install large cushions on the earbuds, to get them to seal in your ear canal good enough to provide good isolation.> COMFORT ‚Äì The secret to comfort when using earbuds is to use the smallest cushions which work for you.  Three sets, small, medium, and large are included with the Sony MDREX15LP earbuds. You might be most comfortable  with smaller cushions.  It a can also take a while to build up tolerance.  So, if earbuds hurt your ears, build up slowly wearing them a little longer each day.  It can take weeks to get to the point that you can wear them all day long without pain.  Changing, or replacing, earbud cushions is easy --  just pull the cushion off, and push the new one (or cleaned one) back on.> PLUG ‚Äì The plug is angled, at 90 degrees, unfortunately. If you pull on the cord, you won't easily pull the plug out the socket, but you will put on strain on the cord (where the cord attaches to the plug), and potential damage it.  In my experience, this is how most headphones fail.> PACKAGING ‚Äì The Sony MDREX15LP earbuds that I purchased came in wonderful frustration‚Äìfree packaging ‚Äî in a small plastic bag in a small easy-to-open cardboard box.  But, I can‚Äôt promise that you won‚Äôt get a horrible retail anti-theft pack.  Amzn used to promote and feature frustration-free packaging -- but, sadly, doesn't anymore.> SLEEPING ‚Äì The Sony MDREX15L don‚Äôt stick out as far as some other brands, and so, may be more comfortable when resting with your head to the side (or inside a helmet).  Panasonic ErgoFit fit deeper in the ear, and are a little more comfortable in such situations.  APTEK offers a nice earbud set for sleeping that is even smaller‚Äìbut the cushion is built-in, so you can‚Äôt choose the cushion size.  However, even with the APTEKs, I cannot comfortably sleep with an earbud in the ear that is on the pillow.  My solution ‚Äì I just use one earbud in the ear that is NOT on the pillow.  In fact, I recycle earbud sets where one earbud has failed, by cutting the failed earbud off, and using the working earbud, shifting the earbud from ear to ear if I change sides.> TIP ‚Äì CLEANING EARBUDS ‚Äì The build up of earwax is a serious problem.  It can actually muffle and distort or block the sound, and when it gets that bad, effective cleaning is difficult or impossible.  The best and simplest strategy is to take a look at your earbuds every few days, and vigorously scratch/flick the open hole of the cushion several times.  That breaks loose the wax into flakes, which you can then just blow away.  Wiping (such as with a Q-tip) doesn‚Äôt work so well (unless you take the cushions off, clean them, and reinstall  them), because wiping with a Q-tip may just grind wax into the little screen in front of the speakers, which is then impossible to clean.  Caveat, Sony MDREX15L earbud cup-cushions are a slightly different shape from other brands, with a smaller hole, and seems to collect less earwax -- even so, regularly checking and clearing earwax is a good thing to do.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Five Stars! Great price for high quality watch!
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I was so surprised when I ordered this watch because it was an amazing price for a great quality watch. It is very comfortable to wear, and comes with extra band, and acts just like an Apple Watch. Has so many apps to use, clear to read, and charges so fast! The battery literally lasts for like three or four weeks without having to charge it again which is such a plus. Has time passer games that work really well, and is just a great watch. It also has so many free and cool watch faces of all styles on the app to choose from, which helps you customize your r30 pro better! Great fitness tracker and has endless  exercise options! The only cons to this watch is that it cannot connect to an iPad, and that it is not waterproof. Make sure to take your watch off before jumping into the pool or lake, or taking a shower. Also, Siri, receiving messages, and calling does not work when your phone is not right by you, because those features only work with Bluetooth. Overall I am very happy with this smart watch, it does its job well!

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Setup with connecting to my phone was simple, you will get text message notifications if you are synced to your phone. productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I didn't review this at first because it just works. It's affordable and it works. After about 4 months the camera started to intermittently not connect and I had a heck of a time pulling up recorded clips... If I can't review the clips or connect in real time what good is the camera? I actually have two of these and the one in the rear of my place always worked flawlessly. Both had great wifi connection. So, I figured I just bought a cheap camera and it worked for a short time and lesson learned. But, there's a button in the app for customer care. Wow. I just relayed the issue and before you know it the agent "Deer" was sending me a new camera. He didn't have me send the old one back and wait till it was recieved or anything you get from most places these days. It was out of the  Amazon return windrow, so I expected to be out of luck. It was just super quick old time good customer service. Now, I got the replacement, slapped it back in the same place as the original, and it works perfectly. And I still have the faulty one & I think I'm going to try to figure out why it was failing... I bet the wifi antenna is buggered. I'm impressed, the camera works well (no subscription with a microsd), great resolution, quick interaction over wifi and cell coverage from wherever, and awesome service!

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I got the 4g cam so that I could place it out in my backyard on my chicken coop. productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Stop buying trail cams, see nature live as it happens.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I have remote property and have been trying a variety of trail cams for tracking the wildlife and providing a bit of security. They have all fallen short primarily due to the lack of actual live feeds that you can view and control. Even the highest rated name brands just don‚Äôt live up to the fact that this 2025 and we want to see with our system without getting $5‚Äôed and $10‚Äôed for every request.  But now I have found what I am looking for.  This system has it ALL.Easy installation, SD card slot, Simple activation, reasonable fees that are inclusive of everyday camera usage, cloud storage to boot, solar powered, and 100% completely controllable from your device. The app could stand a face lift and bit of user experience upgrades, but it gives you the controls you need to modify pretty much every detail of camera configuration, storage, and camera control, including pan, tilt and zoom. SD and HD image modes, even with live feeds. Pull photos through cell from the cameras card or their super fast cloud service if you pay a little extra.  Battery life is not an issue, the solar panels keep them topped off, even in the worst Texas weather.Better still the company cares about its customers. I had one camera that just was not responding well and was difficult to get images. They helped me trouble shoot it asynchronously via the app messaging system (Might be better if they used Business Messaging) and when that didn‚Äôt work promptly replaced the camera. I‚Äôm blown away by how well I have been treated.I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll be buying more cameras soon and recommending them to all my neighbors. They are always impressed with the quality of images and simple access, even in the our mostly remote location.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Great security camera, with high definition imaging.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: These cameras are surprisingly good for the price. The video quality is super sharp, and the pan/tilt feature is so helpful for checking the full room. I use one for watching my cat while I‚Äôm out and another as a basic home security cam. The app is really easy to use, and I love that you can talk through it or even use it with Alexa.The motion detection is spot on and customizable, so I‚Äôm not constantly getting alerts unless something real is happening. Setup took like five minutes, and the night vision is clear enough to see everything even in total darkness. Whether you‚Äôre using them for pets, kids, or peace of mind, these little guys pack a punch.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Works great. I had some Samsung cameras but last month the app they use was taken down because it's so old ..I think it was called SmartCam. I'm actually happy that's happened, because these cameras have way better picture quality and are faster and easier to use. And it's much better than Ring because there's no subscription unless you need cloud. Other than that everything is free all of the features are free and it's great!For people saying that they won't connect.. I had a problem with one of the cameras not connecting and it was simply because my routers uses both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz and these cameras only use 2.4. So you have to find a way to make sure your router is using the 2.4 when you set these up. I'm on a Nest system and you can't select between 2.4 or 5 so it took a couple of tries for it to register on the 2.4 frequency.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I did hours of research trying to find a budget friendly, quality camera, WITH NO SUBSCRIPTION. This camera is perfect! I use it to check in on my cats during the day since I leave at 4am and get home at 2pm. The night vision and day vision camera quality is surprisingly good (the camera doesn't zoom in but you can zoom in on your screen on the app). The app is easy to use as well and I haven't had any connectivity issues at all. My Wi-Fi is 5ghz but in the My Spectrum app it lets you switch it to 2.5ghz temporarily to set up the camera and it was super easy and worked well. I have been using the camera for a week now and I don't regret buying it (except I should have got a 2 pack). It has a privacy mode to turn off the camera when I am home which is nice. The cable is probably close to 8 feet long. The speaker is decent and it has a mini SD card slot. I like that it also has an option for both motion detection and person detection. I don't want notifications every time my cats run back and forth but I do want to know if there is someone in my house so I leave only the person detection on and it works 100% of the time (my mom goes over to visit them and it always sends notifications). I use it for security at night too with the alarm system you can set up. You can chose lights, siren, or both and you can set it for manual on or scheduled. Gives me an extra peace of mind on the nights I am home alone. 100% recommend this camera (save yourself the hours of research, I did it for you)!!!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I switched from the tp-link kasa version of these cameras to the tapo ones..they are basically the same camera but the tapo ones have rstp and onvif protocols so you can view them on other apps and hook them up to a nvr etc.  ALSO, it has a couple of triggers (maybe just one) you can use in home assistant or ifttt.. AND, so far ive see use with google assistant/google home is limited to casting to chromecast (you can't control the camera with the assistant... just say to cast it to a tv).to use the tapo cameras you must use tHE tapo app.  you can add kasa cameras to the tapo app but NOT tapo cameras to the kasa app!!  the tapo app is almost the same as the kasa app.  The tapo cameras have a few other features that show in the tapo app.one downside is that the use a 9V adapter (not usb like the kasa cameras).. so you have to plan out how to hide the horrendous block (with the kasa ones i have usb outlets so its easier, and in hard to reach places i used usb light bulb sockets where I it converts a light socket into a usb charger and light bulb socket).. there are light bulb adapters that can give you a regular plug to plug the tapo camera into but then again the problem is the unsightly 9v block.Anyway, you take the good with the bad.  I guess for some reason these cameras need more juice to work.Ive got a 256 microsd card installed and it records 24/7.you can select activity zones, notifications, dectect baby crying, detect person etc etccrystal clear images, etc, etc..the app is fine, you can do everything with it that you need to.. no subscription needed (of course it always asks you during setup or there is an annoying icon next to the standard icons (pan/tlit, talk, alarm, etc) about 'tapocare' that i would rather not see if I never plan to pay for it.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I'm very impressed with the quality of video and the camera has an amazing sound pickup too.Easy to install and the app is easy to navigate through. You can even zoom inImpressive night vision too.I like this camera brand that this one is my second time purchasing it because I needed another one.Highly recommended
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Excellent product, easy to set up the quality image it is good and all the functions work great. It is a good product

title: TP-Link Tapo 2K Pan/Tilt Security Camera for Baby Monitor, Pet Camera w/ Motion Detection and Tracking, 2-Way Audio, Night Vision, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works w/ Alexa & Google Home (Tapo C210)
description: With crystal clear 2K HD video, the Tapo C210 Home Security Wi-Fi gives you the ability to always keep an eye on your family, pets, and protect your home. With person and motion detection, get instant notifications that matter when there is activity going on. Also used as a baby camera monitor, Tapo C210 provides free baby crying detection. Check what's inside your home, even at night with night vision thanks to the integrated IR sensor. With device sharing, you and a family member can both monitor the feed making keeping an eye on the little ones just a little bit easier. Save footage continuously onto a 512 GB micro-SD card (not included) or subscribe to Tapo Care for 30-day video history and many other benefits. [Before purchasing a microSD card, please check the TP-Link website FAQ to ensure compatibility with your device.] With crisp 2-way audio, you'll never truly be away again with the ability to hold clear conversations with who's there. Additionally, keep your family safe from unwanted intruders by playing the built-in siren and light alarm.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Great product especially for the price.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I've used several different smart watches over the last could of years and this one has been my favorite!Very light weight but a very sleek look. Does not look as cheap as some of the others I've used. There's a quick text reply which is handy. I haven't had any issues with the Bluetooth disconnecting like others watches. I like that it has the option to control the music but can also play the music from the watch. Another big thing that is very helpful is that it allows for lots of different app to receive notifications which other watches have only selected apps that it can receive notifications from. There are also a couple of games on the watch which is cool. The watch also monitors your sleep all day and not just at night. It also tracks your REM sleep. One down fall is that it is limited on watch faces that it offers.

I tried every trouble shooting recommendation even tried a replacement watch thinking it was just an issue with that specific one. Very disappointing!!

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: What I really love is it counts every step. Not able to shake your arm for steps they must be taken. Decided to sleep with it on last night. Sleep was 4 hrs. 30 min.  Just because your eyes are closed does not mean you're sleep, tracks deep and light sleep mins. Love notification Bing keeps me from pulling phone out. Able to turn on and off what notifications you want to receive. Love you can put face on screensaver, date. So many activity features including games. I highly recommend this watch. People paying big money for watches that do the same thing this one does. Haven't figured out camera or contacts yet, keep saying go to Halo fit app

Not really a big deal, we aren't using this for 24/7 security, and if we mounted it on the wall instead of just putting it on the mantle, that wouldn't be a problem. App is also nice and all the configuration possibilities.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I‚Äôve been using the TP-Link Tapo Pan/Tilt Security Camera as a baby monitor, and overall, it‚Äôs a fantastic product. The picture quality is clear, both during the day and at night, and the pan/tilt function lets me see the whole room easily. It‚Äôs quick and simple to set up through the app, and I love that I can check on my baby from anywhere.The motion detection works well and sends timely notifications, which is a huge plus for peace of mind. I also use it as a pet camera, and it‚Äôs been reliable for keeping an eye on my dog during the day.The only reason I didn‚Äôt give it five stars is the slight delay in loading the live view at times, but it‚Äôs not a huge issue. For the price, it‚Äôs a fantastic option with plenty of features that work smoothly. Highly recommend for parents or pet owners looking for a solid, budget-friendly camera!

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Flawed -  Better than other New Similar ONVIF/ RTSP IP Cameras
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I empathize with other reviewers who staate "Tapo is Crappo".  This new ONVIF/RTSP camera does not compare to the quality or functionality of the older PTZ cameras which had many options and were easy to view/manage in just about any IP Camera viewer app.For starters, there is no way you can use this camera without installing the Tapo app.  Why must you eat up your precious phone memory by installiing a NEW app for every piece of hardware you want to access remotely?  Well folks, that seems to be the Brave New World of proprietary products and self-centered corporations manufacturing the products we need.This camera has no setup where you can browse into the camera and change all the settings.Can you assign a static IP?  NOPE.Can you assign a custom camera port #?  NOPECan you assign preset positions?  NOPECan you use an http browser to connect to the camera, adjust settings, and view streaming video?  NOPE, NOPE, and NOPEThe mounting options are cheap.  In the past you were given a bracket that allowed you to adjust in the vertical and hoizontal planes.  This comes with the cheapest mounting bracket that would be possible for the human brain to conceive.Is horizontal adjustment possible?  NOPEIs vertical adjustment possible?  NOPEYou essentially stick this on any horizonal or surface the way you want it with no possibility to fine turn where the camera is pointing, via bracket.  You must "hope" that the PTZ movement of the camera is able to point it where you want to view.  If not, then you're either SOL or you must purchase a camera mounting bracket to give you the movements that should have been included as standard.Given all I say above,  you might be surprised to know that my opinion this camera is that it's not a bad camera and could be consideered better than average, considering the competition.Yes, many would consider this crappo and I'd have to include myself in that crowd, but if you consider the limitations vs. price, then this camera becomes a little less crappo because its' limations can be managed, especially when you consider that all the newer ONVIF/RTSP cameras that I've investigated, many at a MUCH higher price, has the same or worse defects than this camera.So, what were considering is what is the LEAST Crappy camera available?Believe or not, folks, this is probably the Least Crappy camera out there.Your system prerequisite if you want to use a non-Tapo view app to view/operat this camera is that you need to setup Port forwardings of 2020 (internal) and 554 (internal) to the IP Address for EACH C200 camera on your network.  Your router must be able to make IP Reservatons for DHCP for the IP of this camera.  If not, your IP will keep changing and you'll  continually lose remote access to this camera because setting a statis IP Address in camera setup is impossible.  But, if you can setup and IP Reservation on your router and can port forward for EACH camera to 2020 and 554 to each camera then you're likely okay with this camera.Once this is done, you might be able to view this camera on 3rd party IP Camera viewer app that support ONFIV/RTSP.Because TAPO is an Alexa skill, it's pretty easy to view this camera on any Alexa Echo SHOW device.  I setup a routine (Named for my cat) that will cause Alexa echo Show to view a fixed position stream of my camera.  You CANNOT move the camera using Alexa echo Show, but you can view the camera stream from where it's positioned right now.The Tapo cloud service is worthless, but if you add a 128gb micro SD card, then you can save detected motion to know what's happening when something moves in front of the camera to trigger recoding.  This works pretty well and gives you several minutes of recording time.  You cannot just click and download these clips, which is idiotic.  But, if you play the clip, then click "Record" you can record the playing clip, then download this recording.  It's convoluted, but better than removing the SD card, placing into PC, and copying over the clip(s).I definitely am not in LOVE with this camera, and if a REAL camera came along that would allow me to view on Alexa echo Show, browse into configure all aspects of the camera, and use on  any 3rd party remote view app, then I'd jump ship in a second and buy  THAT camera.But... given that ALL these type cameras SUCK, I woudl choose THIS camera because it sucks at  a LOWER price.  So, if your camera sucks, it's better to pay less for a sucky camera, if you can.Right now with the state of suck in IP Cameras, I'd recommend this camera as a BUY.  I don't like it much, but it's better than whatever else you might be able to buy at a reasonable price.Just like when voting for political candidates, sometimes you just have to go  with the one that sucks less out of a field of choices that all suck.Good Luck!!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2022

title: TP-Link Tapo Pan/Tilt Security Camera for Baby Monitor, Pet Camera w/Motion Detection, 1080P, 2-Way Audio, Night Vision, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa & Google Home (Tapo C200)
description: Make your home security smarter with Tapo C200 smart indoor security camera Wi-Fi. This Pan/Tilt IP camera sees everything across an entire room or walkway with the 360¬∞ horizontal and 114¬∞ vertical range pan/tilt field of view. Get instant push notifications when motion, person, or baby crying is detected from this baby camera monitor, all with no additional fee. Check what‚Äôs inside your home, even at night with night vision up to 30ft. with integrated IR sensor. Use 2-way audio with built-in siren to see as a pet camera with phone app and ward off intruders. Fully compatible with Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant, use your simple voice command to view Tapo indoor security camera live stream on Echo Show or Google Chorme Cast with a screen. Save footage continuously on up to a 512 GB microSD card (not included) or subscribe to Tapo Care for cloud storage which saves 30-day video history and provides additional benefits such as motion tracking, baby crying detection, and more. [Before purchasing a microSD card, please check the TP-Link website FAQ to ensure compatibility with your device.]

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: I love love love this watch.  I put the watch face onto a leatherman bracelet.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: The Samsung Galaxy Watch 4 Classic 46mm is a feature-rich and stylish smartwatch that blends the best of traditional watch design with modern technology. The rotating bezel, advanced health and fitness features, and Wear OS functionality make it a versatile choice for Android users, especially those who want to track their health and stay connected on the go. While the battery life could be better, the fast charging feature helps mitigate this concern. If you're looking for a high-end, well-rounded smartwatch with a classic design, the Galaxy Watch 4 Classic is a top contender.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Amazing Watch! No longer worried about battery.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: My biggest concern when buying this watch was battery life. When it came initially, I put it on the charger for over an hour, but still had no sign of it charging. I was worried I got a defective watch or charger. I called support, and they were very kind, and said to let it charge for another hour, and then to call again if it still showed no sign. 2 HOURS later, I picked up my phone to call again, and right at that moment it turned on. It only showed 2% on the charge, but I was really happy to see it working. It took a while to reach a decent charge, about 50%, but then I took it off and got to work setting it up.Updates took a while, and even at one point it told me a few times it couldn't update for whatever reason. Past that, I've had no issue. After about an hour it had drained over 40%, and my concerns over battery life started to become true. I set the display to be the lowest it could be, I turned off location, and turned off the feature that automatically wakes up my watch screen. Still didn't help.BUT, once all the updates were done and day 2 came around, it had amazing battery life. I put it on the charger in the mornings when I shower and get ready for the day, about an hour, and it's fully charged after that. Even as of now, sitting here writing this review, about 36 hours since the last charge, I've just passed 40% battery.I will admit, I don't use a lot of apps. I bought this for the silent alarms and health monitoring, so lets talk about that. It easily detects when I start walking long distances, so I don't have to search for that function. The last two days it's been giving me reminders to start moving again after sitting for too long. I don't know where to turn it off (I've looked) but it's grown on me and I like it. This watch has better sleep tracking than my last, and its been very helpful to me. Vibrations are really strong, which I really like for silent notifications and alarms... I am a heavy sleeper though, so I have yet to wake up to any of these alarms without the sound. I really like the rotating bezel, but I'm afraid its been the culprit of accidently dismissing and snoozing alarms. It's not my only alarm source, but I kind of wish it was, to avoid waking roommates.It's been great at tracking heart rates, also something essential for me. I set it to track it all the time, because every 10 minutes would often miss the times I felt my heartrate skyrocket. It's had no impact on the battery, which I think is great.I have a rather small wrist, so maybe I should have gotten a smaller watch, but I do like the fit regardless. The band that comes with it makes it kind of uncomfortable, and I constantly have a weird gap because of how stiff the band is. It's gotten better the more I've worn it, but its still there after about a week, so I'm planning on buying another. It's really lightweight, haven't ever felt like it was too heavy. I got a simple black model, which I really appreciate since I work on concert venues quite often, and black attire is normal for me.All in all, I really love this watch, and would definitely recommend to anyone. If you plan on using the watch for the apps, I think another watch would be better for the batter life, but for my use it's been perfect.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Out of the box, there were a LOT of updates, as expected.What I like:Lot's of app options. I use activity tracker, nutrition, reminders, alarms, text, phone and some media.Fit is good, stays in place on wrist with little movement. Felt a bit heavy at first, but I became accustomed within 2-3 days. Now I don't notice it.Plenty of customizable watch faces. Easy to understand and install.Screen clarity is very good.Touch screen is also customizable, I was able to adjust presets to better suit my use.FYI - Watch will not charge on older power blocks. Make sure your blocks are 2.0.What I disliked:Battery life is the only serious disappointment. For a watch that recommends wearing at night, I would expect 48 - 72 hr batt life, mine gets approx 24 hrs.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Very much enjoying my new watch!
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I'm very much enjoying this watch.  I refuse to spend much money on a watch, so when this went on sale at a bargain price, I went for it.  I came from an Amazfit that was starting to annoy my by refusing to do alerts.  This Samsung watch is a couple of generations old and is refurbished.  I cannot tell that is isn't brand new, and everything works well.  I have a Samsung phone, so using the Samsung Wear app and syncing to the watch was super easy.  Battery life is great - I'm at 75% after using it all day (no way am I going to be wanting to sleep with a watch on!).  The step count is accurate.  Setting what apps to alert was easy.  The display is nice and bright.  I haven't bothered with EKG or other body measurements - I care about step counts.  Along with that it purports to measure activity and calories expended - I have no way to know if they're accurate...  Anyway, bottom line - I'm very happy with this watch!

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: The features and design of this watch are great but straight out the box the battery life is terrible. Yesterday to today I got 26 hours with raise to wake and moderate use (no AOD, no power saving) and it was on 13% when I charged it again. Works great now! Very satisfied!

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: The interface and app are meh. The watch is great otherwise.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Originally purchased this watch June 2023. Loved the watch and used it daily until it stopped turning on (Jan 2025). Bought a new one and they changed the interface entirely. They also now use a new app, which is a downgrade.The new interface is simply awful and not intuitive. I primarily use this watch to track steps and set 2-3min timers at the gym. Finding the timer was challenging, and now it disappears from the screen while in use unless you click on the icon again. I liked being able to look at the timer at all times while using it. Additionally, clicking the button while the screen is on now opens up a menu. Previously this turned the screen off. I don't like this change.I returned the 2nd watch due to the above changes. I kept 4 stars in my review because I still think it's an excellent quality watch. The battery lasted days, it tracked steps well, and could take a beating. It just no longer is suited to my primary needs.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Superior comfort and sound on a budget
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: All in all a fantastic value. Comfortable for extended wear with decent sound quality and some handy convenience features.I bought these as a spare set of headphones just in case I needed some because they were so affordable. I didn't have high expectations for them but they ended up being my go-to pair of headphones while I save up for a more expensive pair.No noise-cancelling but I use them mostly at home on my computer so it's not been an issue for me, I take my others with noise cancelling on outings. They're very comfortable, with deeper than average cups for a budget set of headphones and actual padding over the speakers rather than just a sheet of colored mesh.Sound quality is good, I don't feel I'm robbed of anything while playing video games or listening to music. Though to get the best sound quality when gaming or watching movies I use the "heavy base mode" Makes things like footsteps/atmospheric soundscapes come through a lot brighter. The battery life is great, I can go a few days of long sessions before they need a charge. And any usb-c cord will do the job, so I can keep using them while plugged in.Seemless switching between bluetooth devices. If I get a phone call while I'm at my computer it switches to my phone instantly. Very handy for multitasking. Same thing if I switch to my phone to watch some things there.The mic quality is probably that of your average telephone receiver, nothing to brag about but perfectly functional.Like with most bluetooth connective devices the sound quality absolutely tanks if you try to use the built-in microphone while listening to music or other media. This is only really an issue if you're the type to multitask on your computer or your phone and you don't have another external mic to use for conference calls. It ceases to be a problem if you have another microphone hooked up to your computer, though. So if you do, just make sure you use that one instead.I give it a 9 out of 10
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I recently purchased the DOQAUS Upgrade Bluetooth Headphones, and I couldn't be more thrilled with my choice! These over-ear headphones are an absolute game-changer for anyone who values sound quality and comfort.First off, the 90-hour playtime is impressive! I can listen to music, podcasts, or watch movies for days without needing to recharge. The Bluetooth 5.3 technology ensures a seamless connection with my devices, and I've experienced minimal lag and excellent range.The sound quality is top-notch. The bass is rich and deep without overwhelming the mids and highs, making every genre of music enjoyable. Whether I'm listening to classical, rock, or pop, the audio experience is consistently clear and immersive.Comfort is another standout feature. The ear cups are soft and plush, making them perfect for extended listening sessions. I can wear them for hours without any discomfort, which is a huge plus for me.The build quality feels durable, and I appreciate the sleek design that looks great on. Plus, the controls are intuitive and easy to use, allowing for quick adjustments without fumbling around.Overall, I highly recommend the DOQAUS Upgrade Bluetooth Headphones to anyone looking for reliable, high-quality wireless headphones. They deliver on every front‚Äîbattery life, sound quality, and comfort‚Äîmaking them a fantastic value for the price!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Headphones are great for the price. Only issue I have is the left speaker fails after some time.These headphones are great if you are looking for simple pretty bare bones headphones to listen to music or watch videos. The sound quality is perfectly acceptable, it pairs well to devices, battery life is surprisingly long on a single charge, and they're comfortable. There isn't any ear pressure on the lobes or noticeable top of head pressure. There is a mic that can be used for calls or voice commands but quality isn't great. It will work fine though.  In terms of basic use case these headphones are a surprisingly superb deal.One particular characteristics are nice in my book is the start up and shut down is very fast. So you don't have to wait and/listen to a 3 or 4 second '"startup sound," headphone name, heavy bass mode, wireless connected' every time. It's a simple "hello, Bluetooth connected" the moment you hold the power button. And shutting off is almost instant with a quick sound and done.The sole reason I'm docking a star is because out of 3 pairs I've consistently had the left side speaker fail on me. I'm not entirely sure why, but it's always after several months of use. I've taken apart the broken ones to see what's failing. I can instantly see the connection for the left speaker is a plug with the connection to the circuit board possibly prone to wear and tear. While the right side speaker is soldered directly to the circuit board. Unsure why this is but it's a simple design fix that could prevent any failing speaker.I'll reiterate that, aside from my annoying experiences, these are a very great deal for anyone who just wants simple good quality headphones.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic, if you understand what it is.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I wanted some thing small and simple which would give me good audio and an improved picture as compared to the front facing camera on my iPhone 15 Pro Max.I wanted it to be small for portability and capable of producing very good video on automatic settings, since I shoot my Vlogs very quickly and extemporaneously. I don‚Äôt have the inclination to check for perfect exposure, etc..This camera is smaller than you probably think it is. Perfectly pocketable.  Video on this is substantially better than video from the front facing camera on my phone. The audio from the built-in mics are better than the iPhones, meaning I don‚Äôt need to use a Lavalier or other microphone for really fantastic audio.I tried a budget action cam, But the picture was not appreciably better than Myphone and in some cases was worse. The microphone was garbage and it had no standard jack for audio. It had a proprietary port, so I returned it..I paid absolute full price for this, missing the Amazon sales unfortunately. Yet, I‚Äôm not returning this camera. It is my new vlog camera.I am very, very, very happy with a spectacular picture, quality and remarkable audio. The view from my mounting bracket is plenty wide.I have a Sony ZVE 10 for more serious filming, but this pocket guy does such a good job that it will become my workhorse.You‚Äôre going to get a better picture than an action cam and a microphone jack, but you may not need it. You‚Äôre not going to get a better picture than a Sony ZVE 10 or a 1000 or 2000 or $5000 DLSR or mirrorless camera.What you will get is video that is almost as good from a tiny little package that really impresses..Highly recommended

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: More complicated than it needs to be for still pictures
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: My rating is for those of us who just want a relatively small but powerful camera. I am not a vlogger or content creator; I needed to replace my 12 year old Canon and this takes very good pictures, better than my iPhone. The touch screen is helpful, and it's easy to use once you have settings where you want them. But there are a LOT of settings which I assume are helpful if you have very specific video needs, but for me I won't use most of them. One thing to note: if you want to use a cord to transfer to your computer (I put everything in Dropbox as my storage provider) you need a special HDMI cord to do so. My home computer has a memory card port which is what I did, but if you don't have that, you need that HDMI cord-- a regular cord won't work.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: The Sony ZV-1F is a dedicated vlog camera designed with content creators and vloggers
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: The Sony ZV-1F is a dedicated vlog camera designed with content creators and vloggers in mind, offering a compact and feature-rich solution for creating high-quality video content. One of its standout features is its exceptional video quality, capable of recording in 4K resolution with vibrant colors and sharp details. This ensures that videos have a professional look suitable for various platforms.The ZV-1F is equipped with advanced autofocus technology, including Real-time Eye AF and Real-time Tracking, ensuring that subjects stay in focus reliably, even in dynamic shooting situations. This feature is crucial for vloggers who need dependable autofocus performance to capture clear and sharp footage.Audio performance is another strong point of the ZV-1F. It features a built-in directional 3-capsule microphone, which captures clear and immersive sound, minimizing background noise effectively. This setup is ideal for vloggers who prioritize excellent audio quality without the need for external microphones.For usability, the ZV-1F includes a vari-angle touchscreen LCD that flips out to the side and rotates fully, making it easy to frame shots and monitor recordings. This flexibility is particularly beneficial for vloggers who need to see themselves while recording or capture creative angles.To maximize your experience with the ZV-1F, I recommend investing in a light attachable for improved lighting in various shooting conditions. Additionally, consider purchasing extra batteries, ideally at least three, to ensure uninterrupted shooting during longer sessions.Despite its strengths, there are a few considerations with the ZV-1F. The battery life is average, which may require frequent recharging for extended shooting sessions. Additionally, while the camera excels in video recording, its performance in low-light conditions, especially in photography mode, may not match up to cameras with larger sensors. If you are a beauty content creator that has a setup I would say to go with another camera. If you‚Äôre coming from an older model phone this is a great upgrade. I‚Äôm still looking for the perfect camera for a beauty creator but upscale from this one the canon r50 is good‚Ä¶ check out my storefront to see the other cameras I‚Äôve tried out and what I suggest as a fixed camera for a beauty, fragrance, lifestyle creator.Overall, the Sony ZV-1F is an excellent choice for content creators and vloggers looking for a compact and feature-packed camera. Its superb video quality, reliable autofocus, excellent audio capabilities, and user-friendly design make it a standout option for creating professional-looking vlogs and video content.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Great camera if you like to print out pictures
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Since it‚Äôs a disposable camera, you have to get them developed at a pharmacy. There aren‚Äôt many pharmacies that do it anymore, but Walgreens does. It doesn‚Äôt have a vintage 1998 filter on it or anything, but the pictures still come out good, at least if you hold it still. It captures perfect memories that will last forever, as long as you get them developed. The lighting will be good whether you use the flash or not, it depends on where you are. It is meant for kids 12 or older. It is camera that has a green, yellow and white background on it. It has a bright, colorful background that brings you back to the late 90s or early 2000s. The flash works, but should be used in the appropriate conditions that it needs.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I‚Äôm part of an outdoor group and bring one of these on every trip so that I‚Äôm not constantly distracted by my phone + burning its battery. productPageReviews.reviewDescription: If you forgot how to use these, there may be a bit of a learning curve to take great photos. However, I am shocked by how well most of my photos turned out! It‚Äôs a durable little camera that stays in my purse, ready for those ‚Äúcandid‚Äù moments that these cameras are famous for. Here are my tips to take great pics:1. Don‚Äôt wind the camera until you‚Äôre ready to take a photo. if you pre-wind, chances are you‚Äôll accidentally take a photo of the ground lol2. Hold the camera as steady as possible3. ALWAYS use the flash if indoors unless in direct sunlight. Basically you should use the flash 99% of the time. Even if you think you‚Äôre in ample light, use the flash4. This camera shines with outdoor pictures5. Do not get camera wet6. Send your film to an ACTUAL film lab if you can, your film will be much more taken care of at an actual lab that specializes in film and your scans/prints will be higher quality7. don‚Äôt think about it too much, just take the pic!

title: Fujifilm QuickSnap Flash 400 One-Time-Use Camera
description: Product DescriptionWhat fun will you develop? The FUJIFILM QuickSnap Flash 400 one-time-use camera is fun and easy to use ‚Äì great for taking pictures indoors or outdoors! It sports a compact body and is pre-loaded with ISO 400 speed film that produces very sharp pictures. It features a built-in flash with a 10‚Äô flash range and a continuous flash switch. This makes it super easy to take multiple shots, letting you focus on the fun of taking the pictures!From the ManufacturerThe QuickSnap Flash 400 camera features a compact body and comes pre-loaded with Fujicolor 400 speed film. This One-Time-Use camera produces very sharp pictures and features a 10-foot built in flash. The QuickSnap Flash 400 camera is fun & easy to use, and is great for taking pictures indoors or outdoors. The continuous flash switch makes it easier to take multiple shots, letting you concentrate entirely on the pictures! What film ISO/speed is loaded into your QuickSnap One-Time-Use Cameras? For the best results in either daylight or flash photography, Fujicolor 35mm QuickSnap one-time-use cameras are loaded with Fujicolor Superia X-TRA ISO 400 Color Print Film. How many exposures are available with your Fujicolor QuickSnaps? Our 35mm format QuickSnaps contain 27 exposures.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Very Good System & Price. Read My Detailed Review
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Overall, I‚Äôm very happy with the Blink camera system (and I‚Äôm not paying for the subscription). One of the reasons I decided to buy into this system was because I didn‚Äôt need a subscription for: 1) Live view option, which means, see the live video from the cameras any time I want via the app, from anywhere.  2) Save videos that were triggered by motion to a USB flash drive (memory stick) inside my house (not cloud only and not stored in the camera itself). Keep in mind, most of my comments here will be related to using the system without a subscription, but I‚Äôll comment on the differences where possible. Also, my comments may be a little more technical than most people would like, but for anyone interested, I‚Äôm being as detailed as possible :-) These comments are relevant as of Feb 2024 (the date I wrote this review).Viewing/Storing Your Videos: During the trial subscription period when I could view my motion-triggered saved videos in the cloud, I noticed the videos load/play quicker than if you‚Äôre accessing the videos stored on the USB flash drive in the Sync Module 2. Anyway, not a big deal, but it‚Äôs a difference. You need to provide a USB flash drive to plug in to the Sync Module, but those are very cheap these days and a 128GB drive will give you TONS of storage for videos since the file size of the videos is not very big. Also, with the cloud subscription there‚Äôs a thumbnail for each video saved, which can be helpful in finding important videos if you‚Äôre trying to find one with people in it, rather than a video triggered by a dog. Without a subscription, there‚Äôs no thumbnail on the saved videos which you view in your app, and it takes several seconds for them to load/play in your app, but it‚Äôs bearable. The nice thing is, if you don‚Äôt have a subscription, the videos save to your flash drive/memory stick in the Sync Module 2 immediately after the recording is finished. If you have a subscription, the videos only download to your Sync Module‚Äôs USB flash drive once per day, at night (as I understand it).Sync Module 2 & Wireless Signals to Wi-Fi & Cameras:  The Sync Module is required for the cameras, but you get one of those if you buy a package, like I did. I bought the bundle that included two Outdoor 4 cameras, one video doorbell and the Sync Module 2. It‚Äôs important to know the Sync Module and the cameras have TWO wireless signals. One that needs to connect to your home (or business) 2.4GHz Wi-Fi network and one that is only for use by the Sync Module and cameras and that signal is a ‚ÄòLow-Frequency Radio‚Äô (LFR) signal. It does not have 5GHz, but you don‚Äôt want that anyway because the 5GHz signal is weaker than 2.4GHz signal. The Sync Module is where you connect a USB flash drive (memory stick) to save your videos if you‚Äôre not paying for a subscription (and also for once-daily backups of your videos if you ARE paying for a subscription). PLACEMENT OF THE SYNC MODULE IS IMPORTANT! Remember, it has TWO signals. It needs to be placed in an area that has a good signal to your home/business Wi-Fi AND so that it also has a good signal to all your cameras (if you have them spread out in different areas around your home or outside your home). To give you some perspective, my house is a single-story ranch style house (around 1,700 sq ft) and I have a camera outside on each wall (each wall is brick). I was able to place the Sync Module and my Wi-Fi access point in the center of my house. Even in this central location, I have one camera (the video doorbell, about 38‚Äô away from sync module and Wi-Fi access point) that has only 2 to 3 bars (out of 4) for the Wi-Fi connection but usually 4 bars for the Sync Module connection. Long story short, make sure you place the sync module, your Wi-Fi access point and the cameras so they all connect to each other with as strong a signal as possible for best performance/reliability. It worked out well for my house, especially since I have flexibility on where I can place my sync module and home Wi-Fi access point and the technical knowledge and tools to move it wherever I needed it.Outdoor 4 Camera:  The image quality/exposure for these cameras is very good. The nighttime IR (infrared) view is very good also (it will appear like black and white footage). The coverage of the IR light when it‚Äôs dark is also very good and has better coverage than I would have expected. I have motion-triggered flood lights outside my house anyway, so if my lights are triggered, the camera may not use IR because it sees enough light (at that point it will record normal video in color just like it does during daylight). I bought 25 ft long third-party USB-C cords with a power supply to use as the power source for my Outdoor 4 cameras so I never have to replace batteries and so I can view live video from the cameras as much as I want and also have the infrared light set to High without impacting battery life, because there are no batteries to worry about :-). I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs different WITH a subscription, but the longest period you can record when the camera is triggered by motion is 60 seconds. For the video doorbell the max record time per motion trigger is 30 seconds, just so you know. Regarding the power, I drilled a hole in the bricks of my house (in the mortar actually) to feed power to my Outdoor 4 cameras. One camera is directly under a soffit, so there‚Äôs no danger of rain getting in there where the power cord connects (but the cord I bought is weather sealed anyway, not a normal USB-C cord). The other camera is mounted under a third-party security camera cover to keep the sun from beating down on it all summer (it‚Äôs on a south wall) and to keep rain off it, just in case‚Ä¶because again, I decided to power this one by a cord that plugs into the back of the camera instead of using the batteries). The included mount is very nice and flexible. If you mount an Outdoor 4 camera under a white security camera cover like I did, you may need to paint the underside of that cover with flat black paint because at night (in my case) the infrared light reflected off the underside of the cover/shield I‚Äôm using over my outdoor 4 camera and that made the video made difficult to see clearly. Daylight videos were unaffected, it was just at night in low light when the IR light was active for video recording that was a problem with that aftermarket cover I bought.Doorbell Camera:  For the video doorbell the max record time per motion trigger is 30 seconds. Why, I don‚Äôt know. Technical limitations? The Outdoor 4 cameras can record 60 seconds of motion triggered video. The wireless signals for the doorbell camera seem to be a little weaker than the outdoor 4 cameras. One big disappointment is that the video doorbell camera can NOT be powered by your existing doorbell power wire. My old Skybell brand video doorbell CAN be powered by the doorbell wires, so it‚Äôs a bummer that Blink can‚Äôt do the same. You can connect your existing doorbell wires to trigger your indoor doorbell, so that‚Äôs good‚Ä¶but like I said, you can‚Äôt use that wire to power the video doorbell. I confirmed this with Blink tech support. I hope they have a new version in the future that is able to be powered solely by the doorbell power wires, but for now, I have to keep batteries in it. The video doorbell device has a weaker infrared (IR) light than the Outdoor 4 cameras and lesser quality video than the Outdoor 4 cameras, but overall, it‚Äôs good (especially during daylight hours). The included mount is very nice and easy to install.Motion Triggering of Videos + Privacy:  The settings/customization for when motion triggers video recording is very good. You have the option to block out as much of the scene as you need to to prevent unwanted triggering of video recordings, such an area of the scene where tree limbs often blow around or something like that. For privacy, you have the option to block out 2 custom size areas in the scene you select for privacy reasons so that area in the video is grayed out. The selected privacy area does not trigger when motion happens in that privacy section and also, when other sections in the scene that you allow to be seen trigger video, the video that's recorded has a gray box in the privacy section (all you see is a gray box). That's pretty powerful and useful, if you need it. Regarding motion triggered video recording in general, I've noticed the cameras can accidentally trigger (record) when it's really misty/foggy outside. If there's a lot of mist in the air floating by the motion sensor, it can trigger a recording. Just something to keep in mind because you may need to adjust the motion sensitivity and/or 'disarm' the cameras for a while until the mist clears because you may be getting lots of unwanted/accidental recordings. I have mine adjusted to the point where the cameras almost never accidentally record unless it's very misty outside, which isn't too often where I am.Audio Quality:  The microphones on the Outdoor 4 and video doorbell camera pick up sound very well. I can clearly hear anyone speaking. The closer they are, the better of course, but it's very good. The speaker volume for the cameras is very good as well. It's plenty loud and if anyone is nearby when you activate the camera and start speaking, they'll hear it clearly :-)Blink App for Phone:  The app you can download on your phone for managing the cameras/sync module is very nice and has plenty of options to configure/customize the cameras (motion settings, video quality, audio settings, check status, etc). The app is where you view your videos, but of course if you‚Äôre storing videos on the flash drive connected to the sync module, you can remove that flash drive and plug it in to your computer to see the video files there or make copies of the files for long-term storage‚Ä¶but of course you can also use the app to save a video file to your phone if you want to keep a copy of share it with someone, like the cops :-). I wish they had an app for Windows so I could view the cameras live and see saved videos on the sync module‚Äôs flash drive right from my computer, but at this point there‚Äôs no PC app. I think there used to be one?...but if there was, there isn‚Äôt one now (Feb 2024).Price:  I compared the price of this system and what it can do with other systems like Ring, Nest and Skybell and at this time, the price difference is significant, in my opinion. The Blink system (and what it offers even without a subscription) is better than the other systems I checked out.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: A great value for excellent basic functionality!
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I bought this on behalf of someone else to give as a gift to her daughter. I did take a good look at it before handing it over, and it was definitely stylish, and based on my experience with other smart watches of this caliber, unless I hear otherwise from her, I'm going to tell you that it works quite well! I'm only sorry I forgot to snap a photo of it before I handed it over. But I can tell you that it looks exactly as advertised.These economical and sporty smart watches are really quite wonderful, especially in terms of accurately tracking health and activity. The only ones I've had trouble with are the ones that are slightly more expensive. But you can trust this particular brand for its functionality, battery life and style based on my past experience. This particular version has a very large watch face which is quite welcome for many!If my friend runs into any problems with her watch, I will update this review, and if you see no updates, then you can rest assured all I have spoken here continues to be accurate.For now, I know she is tickled pink (which is the color of the watch band she bought for it as well)! It's very convenient to be able to change out the bands.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: smart watch pleasantly surprised me! Stylish design, a convenient 1.85‚Äù display with vibrant colors, and an intuitive interface. productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I only have 1 complaint about this watch and that's the poor grammar on the weather report feature.  In reference to UV rays for the day, when it's cloudy (which it has been every day since I got this watch) it says "Very Weaker". I don't know maybe on sunny days it will say "Very Sunny" which will make sense? Other than that it is a great watch especially for the price. It connects to my Samsung Note 20 easily and setup & connection via Bluetooth wasn't the easiest but I was able to feel my way through it. I get notifications on the watch for messages etc within seconds of them hitting my phone. Watch stays connected as I walk away from my desk at work and through several walls and closed doors. Watch is also visually appealing. Also holds a great charge. I just wish it would charge on my charging station rather than with a magnetic wire with contacts. But those watches are several hundred dollars. I didn't want to spend that not knowing if I'd wear it regularly. Hopefully it will hold up for a few years. Also I leave the watch a smidgen loose while wearing it. On all of the Smart watches people complain of a rash. Well if it's strapped down and no air can circulate around the device and you don't occasionally disinfect it you're gonna have rashes. Staff lives on everyone's skin and MRSA lives in your nose, so you need to occasionally clean your devices.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I‚Äôve been using the Beats Studio Buds for a while now, and they‚Äôre a solid option if you‚Äôre into bass-heavy sound. They‚Äôre super comfortable, lightweight, and the noise cancellation is decent‚Äînot the best, but good enough for most situations. The sound is punchy, especially for hip-hop and EDM, though the mids and highs could be a bit clearer. Battery life is solid, around 8 hours per charge, but I wish the case had wireless charging. Also, no multi-device pairing, which is a little annoying. Overall, they‚Äôre a great choice if you want stylish, bass-heavy earbuds without breaking the bank.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: The Beats Solo Wireless Earbuds are a game-changer when it comes to both style and sound quality. These earbuds combine the sleek, iconic design that Beats is known for with advanced audio technology to deliver an exceptional listening experience. The sound is rich, balanced, and punchy, with deep bass and clear highs‚Äîperfect for everything from workouts to casual listening or on-the-go use.One of the standout features is the wireless convenience, thanks to Bluetooth connectivity, which pairs seamlessly with your device. Whether you‚Äôre using them with your phone, tablet, or laptop, you can enjoy a hassle-free, cable-free experience. The earbuds also offer an impressive battery life, with up to 8 hours of playback on a single charge‚Äîperfect for all-day use.Comfort is another major plus. The Beats Solo Wireless Earbuds come with multiple ear tip sizes to ensure a secure and comfortable fit, even during intense physical activity. The lightweight design and ergonomic shape make them feel like an extension of your ear, while the sweat- and water-resistant build ensures durability, whether you‚Äôre at the gym or in the rain.The controls are intuitive, with easy-to-use buttons for adjusting volume, skipping tracks, and taking calls. The built-in microphone ensures crystal-clear call quality, and the noise isolation helps keep out distractions, so you can focus on your music or conversations.Overall, the Beats Solo Wireless Earbuds offer a perfect blend of superior sound, comfort, and practicality. Whether you‚Äôre an audiophile or simply someone who loves great sound and style, these earbuds are an excellent choice for any music lover.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2024

However these beats are not the best. In fact, they are basic. It fits well and connects properly but when you by Beats by Dre you think of loud booming bass. None of that. productPageReviews.reviewDescription: The one thing I did not know about these before purchasing was that you can't change any sound settings on them, like increasing the bass volume.  What I did to fix this was go to the sound settings on my phone and do it there by using my equalizer.  There's also an option on my Android for a bass boost so I picked that and now the bass coming through my Beats sound perfect.  If you're like me and like to be able to tinker with the sound, know that you cannot do this with these headphones.  I know my Skullcandy Earbuds gave me this option, so I was expecting the same with these.  Overall, I like my Beat earbuds way more than the Skullcandy Mods that I have.  Sound is better. Earbuds fit tighter in my ear.  Earbuds and case are lighter and smaller and have a sleeker look.
